name: password reset flow
description: Initiate account recovery using the site's ‘Forgot password’ feature for the victim’s account.
why: A common recovery path abused to take over accounts.

name: intercept reset email
description: Open the reset email sent to the victim to complete the password change, by accessing their mailbox or a device already logged in.

name: weak/reused email password
description: Log into the victim’s email using previously leaked or reused credentials.

name: shared device still logged in
aliases: session still active on shared device
description: Use a shared or borrowed device where the victim is still logged in to their mailbox or portal.

name: Credential Stuffing
description: Try email/password pairs leaked from other sites to log in.

name: password spraying
description: Try a small set of common passwords across many users to avoid lockouts.

name: phishing for credentials
description: Trick the user into entering their password on a fake site or page controlled by the attacker.

name: lockout/rate-limit bypass
description: Slow attempts or rotate IPs and accounts to avoid lockout or rate limits.

name: Predictable Password Reset Token
description: The password-reset link uses a guessable token so attackers can take over accounts without email access.

name: No Rate Limiting on Reset
description: Reset flows allow unlimited attempts, enabling token/email brute-forcing and automation.

name: use stolen account’s saved card
description: Place orders using payment methods saved in a compromised account.

name: use leaked card details
description: Use a leaked card number with billing details to place fraudulent orders.

name: small test transactions
description: Run small test purchases to verify stolen card validity before larger orders.

name: stack discounts/referrals
description: Combine multiple discounts or referral credits in unintended ways to reduce order cost below acceptable limits.

name: false 'item not received' claim
description: Claim a legitimate order was not received to obtain a refund or replacement.

name: insecure direct object reference on orders
description: Access or modify another customer’s order by guessing or enumerating order identifiers.

name: join home Wi-Fi
description: Join the same local network as the camera (e.g., weak Wi-Fi password or guest access).

name: access local interface/RTSP
description: Access the camera’s local web interface or RTSP stream when on the same LAN.

name: default admin password
description: Log into the camera using factory default administrator credentials.

name: default or weak stream key
description: Use a default/weak streaming key to pull or push video streams without authorization.

name: predictable link pattern + enumeration
description: Predict the shape of document URLs (project names, dates, IDs) and enumerate to find valid links.

name: find exposed links in public repos/search
description: Locate document links inadvertently posted in public repositories, tickets, or search indexes.

name: use shared device/browser history
description: Recover document URLs from a shared computer’s history or recently-used items.

name: phishing for the link
description: Trick a user into sharing a supposedly private document link.

name: social engineering for sharing
description: Use pretexts to persuade someone with legitimate access to share the document link.
